p: In the period studied (1990 to 2017), the country has faced several dengue epidemics, characterized by a cyclical pattern, with more than 12 million reported cases. Of these, approximately nine million occurred in the last decade (2008 to 2017). The largest epidemics faced by Brazil were recorded in 2015 (1,688,688 cases), with an incidence of 826.0 cases per 100,000 inhabitants, followed by 2013 (1,452,489 cases) and 2016 (1,483,623 cases), with incidence of 722.5 and 719.9 cases per 100 thousand inhabitants, respectively ( Table 1).
